instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad clicks but cursor will not move
threads.message:
got in a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> heavy liquid damage,  have not cleaned it yet.  was missing <CAPACITOR>C7291</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7251</CAPACITOR> guessing some one knocked them off the board. powered on and everythings working except the on board speaker will not play sound(tried a know good speakers already) and the trackpad cursor will not move (also tried 2 known good trackpads)  the click button works but it does not sense movement. 

Thanks for the help. 
Nate

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad clicks but cursor will not move
threads.message: Check 3v3 S3 and S4 to connector. Check 18V5 to connector. For the 18V5 to work trackpad needs to be connected.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad clicks but cursor will not move
threads.message: on <RESISTOR>R5800</RESISTOR> i have 3.3v on pin 1 but pin 2 is 0v and on the connector its 0v. (how does s3 give power to to the trackpad if there is no part connecting <SIGNAL>3V3_S3</SIGNAL> to _s3_tpad?) also on probe 3 for 18v5 with tpad connected i have 0v.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad clicks but cursor will not move
threads.message:
Well, what does it say in the schematic at <RESISTOR>R5800</RESISTOR>?

3V present on pin 18 of J5800?

So 18V5 missing is the issue here. <SIGNAL>Z2_BOOST_EN</SIGNAL> getting to <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>? Trackpad needs to be connected!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad clicks but cursor will not move
threads.message:
at <RESISTOR>R5800</RESISTOR> it says no stuff, i know there is no part there but even looking at the board i dont see how the power hops the pads.  i didn't see any thing connecting the circuit in the board. it no big deal but i am getting ov at pin 18 of the j5800  with and without the tpad connected.  i do have 3.3v tho on pin one of <RESISTOR>R5800</RESISTOR> so the power is coming to there but idk how its connected to pin 2 or to pin 18 of the j5800.  

i have 3.34v at pin 5 of the <CHIP>U5805</CHIP>,  however i'm only getting 1.2v and on pin 4 <SIGNAL>P18V5S5_FB</SIGNAL>, and pin 8 <SIGNAL>P18V5S5_SW</SIGNAL> = 5v  with trackpad connected.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad clicks but cursor will not move
threads.message: Well <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> is dead or something around it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> trackpad clicks but cursor will not move
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R5806</RESISTOR> was missing.  this board had a ton of parts knocked off it. its working now. as always thank you for the help duke! (solved)
